@SuicidalInsanity that's... beautiful *tears*

It's great that the only survivor was the one you were focusing at.

But we really need to make the AI avoid head-ons a bit.

Its not quite as bad as it seems - I ran that 5v5 battle a few times, and that fratricidal bloodbath was more the exception than the rule - most of the time things went like this and turned into a glorious furball:

Spoiler

Oh, okay, and how is your performance running battles with so many planes?
Or did you go easy on the part count?

Those ten aircraft were 390 parts. Lag wasn't too bad; enough to be noticeable, but not enough to turn into a slideshow; maybe 20-25% slowdown? Main issue was setup time and keeping track of things; aircraft like to pair up and duel, once I ended up with planes spread out over 20km or so. Factor in the amount of debris in the air once things got underway, and switching between crafts became troublesome. As an experiment to see what a 5v5 fight would be like, it worked well enough, but I can't recommend it for doing a series of competitive dogfights.

Oh, yes that would lag a bit, BAD-T allows 80 parts per craft, on a total of max 320 parts.
My laptop can handle 250 parts at 30fps-ish, 320 makes the timer mostly yellow.

 

Anyway, while KerbalStuff is down here is a dropbox download link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/z2b5j400nqao7se/AviatorArsenal-1.1.zip?dl=1
